Ingredients.2: 1 salt and ground black pepper to taste

Ingredients.4: 8 ounces fresh mushrooms, sliced 1/4 inch thick

Ingredients.8: 1 salt and ground black pepper to taste

Directions.1: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).

Directions.2: Season chicken on all sides with salt and ground black pepper.

Directions.3: Heat olive oil over medium-high heat in an ovenproof skillet. Place chicken skin-side down in skillet and cook until browned, about 5 minutes.

Directions.4: Turn chicken over; stir mushrooms with a pinch of salt into skillet. Increase heat to high; cook, stirring mushrooms occasionally, until mushrooms shrink slightly, about 5 minutes.

Directions.5: Transfer skillet to the preheated oven and cook until chicken is no longer pink in the center and the juices run clear, 15 to 20 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read 165 degrees F (74 degrees C). Transfer chicken breasts to a plate and loosely tent with foil; set aside.

Directions.6: Set skillet on the stovetop over medium-high heat; cook and stir mushrooms until brown bits start to form on the bottom of the pan, about 5 minutes. Pour water into the skillet, and bring to a boil while scraping the browned bits off of the bottom of the pan. Cook until water is reduced by half, about 2 minutes. Remove from heat.

Directions.7: Stir in any accumulated juices from the chicken into the skillet. Stir butter into mushroom mixture, stirring constantly until butter is completely melted and incorporated.

Directions.8: Season with salt and pepper. Spoon mushroom sauce over chicken and serve.
